snippet: When the Nets surged in the second half, some speculated they were better off without Brook Lopez. But the team’s lack of a low-post presence was a key factor in a loss to Miami.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column; some speculated in second half of regular NBA season that Brooklyn Nets were better off without injured center Brook Lopez, but Nets' conspicuous lack of a low-post presence was a key factor in playoff loss to Miami Heat.
lead_paragraph: When the Nets surged in the second half, some speculated they were better off without Brook Lopez. But the team’s lack of a low-post presence was a key factor in a loss to Miami.

headline.seo: Facing Heat, Nets Show They Miss Brook Lopez
headline.main: A Nets Big Man Casts a Long Shadow With His Absence
headline.print_headline: A Nets Big Man Casts a Long Shadow With His Absence
